intro: Borreria densiflora var. perennis, commonly known as the dense-flowered borreria, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. This perennial shrub is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, white to pink flowers. The leaves are typically opposite, simple, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
